data.title: Great sat morning stop
data.text: Fun place to shop for fresh local items. Only place locally to get them. Sad that Alpharetta does not allow small commerce to make it in the town. Rents way too high.

data.title: No better way to spend Saturday morning
data.text:
The Alpharetta Farmer's Market is a wonderful way to start the weekend.  Located adjacent to many coffee shops in downtown Alpharetta the market offers fresh produce, baked goods, artisan products for the home, and unique fare.  My favorites are the maple syrup from upstate NY and the Dead Sea Salt soap.  

The market seems to grow every year, and the products have become more diverse with higher quality too!

data.title: More than just vegetables.
data.text: Nice and doable since it is not so large. Good selection of a variety of fruits, veggies, sauces, baked goods, and crafts. Best cantaloupe I have ever gotten was purchased here. Some vendors were a little pricey and I ended up spending more than I expected, but did get high premium produce.

data.title: Saturday Morning Adventure
data.text: Saturday mornings strolling through the farmers' market and having breakfast at one of the local establishments is a plus in downtown Alpharetta.  I love to meet my regular vendors on most Saturday mornings and purchase fresh produce and organic meat from them.  It's also a great place to meet new folks and see your neighbors!  I have been coming to the farmers' market on a regular basis for years.  Love our small town feel!

data.title: Good, not great
data.text: Been to this market several times and what vendors are there have some pretty good items.  Whether it is fresh fruits, vegetables, herbs, bakery, meats orseafood, the vendors are nice and quality is good.  Love being able to get things straight from the farms.  If you like farm-to-table (your own), this is the place.   It's not the largest selection of vendors, but the ones that show up make it worth going.

data.title: Best Market in Town
data.text: The vegetables and fruit is FRESH. The store is very clean and the customer service is great.  This was the second time my daughter and I had visited  Alpharetta Farmers Market the price for the fruit and vegetables are not expensive and well worth the price we paid.

data.title: My favorite Farmers Market
data.text: I love this market.  The vendors are friendly.  There is lots of variety.  Only buy or beef and chicken from these folks.  And have started buying the pork.  So happy to know the people who raise the meats.  Makes me feel safer about what we eat.

data.title: Farmers outlet
data.text: Best and authentic place to purchase vegetables, fruits and farmers products. we can avail fresh and good quality product in reasonable rates.

data.title: A very good local farmers market
data.text: A good selection of various fruits and vegetables plus a selection of high end art, craft items, and other foods including baked goods, meats, and more. A good place to people watch.

data.title: Best local farmers market!
data.text: The Alpharetta Farmers' Market is a must-see for locals and visitors!  The market runs each Saturday morning from Spring through Fall and features a large number of regular vendors selling produce, flowers, jams, crafts, and lots of other items!

data.title: Very Convienient
data.text: This market is very clean and always have fresh items on display for consumer. No long lines and I be in and out.

data.title: Great times
data.text: This farmer's market is great you can bring every one in your family including your four legged buddy too. It's been awhile since I have been there but it is fun to go and see what all the genders have .

data.title: Saturday morning outing!!!
data.text: We love the Farmers Market.  It is the biggest in the area.  It not only has fresh fruits and veggies from local farmers but honey, baked goods, humus, eggs, meat, along with a variety of other venders.  Come hungry.  They give out lots of samples.

data.title: A nice Saturday stroll
data.text: This is so cool to check out on a Saturday morning with a cup of coffee and check out all the vendors.  Everything from meats, cheeses, produce, art and jewelry.  Nice to bring the dog for a walk and yes, since this is suburbia, dodge baby strollers.  It is always nice to support locals!

data.title: Fun place on a Saturday morning
data.text: Love seeing all the vendors - some have been coming for years. Love the Capra Gia goat cheese especially when they bring a couple of "kids." Another favorite is the guy who sells plants and vegetable seedlings as they are consistently healthy. If I had a recommendation it would be a good idea for the organizers to stress that the produce vendors sell produce grown as locally as possible.

data.title: Excellent market
data.text: This is one of our favorite Saturday morning activities.  Wonderful variety of vendors and a lot of genuinely locally sourced produce, cheeses, meats, pastries and breads, and much more.  The quality is high and the vendors are happy to talk about their arts and sources.  Often crowded but that's part of the fun.  Parking isn't bad -- just be patient the first time you go -- and it will be better when the City's garage is finished.

data.title: My favorite Farmers' Market.
data.text: This is my favorite market in Georgia.  I love the market on Peachtree Road as well, but it's a little expensive.  The Alpharetta Market is beautifully organized, well-run, and affordable.  It's easy to find parking and the surrounding area has some nice restaurants.  I'll be sorry to see it end for the season!

data.title: Love shopping local and fresh
data.text: Great variety, vendors always ready to share a story. Everything from fresh goat cheese, breads, vegetables, flowers, German pastries and more. Love wandering with my coffee on a Saturday morning. Oh, it's dog friendly, too.

data.title: lovely Saturday morning activity
data.text: This may initially seem like a typical uppity, pretentious, snoozer, suburban activity. But, this is a really lovely, well run, local Farmer's Market. We have been going on and off all summer, and have consistently been impressed with the variety of quality, friendly vendors. We have purchased everything from small batch BBQ sauce, pimento cheese, vegetables, fruit, bread, artisan pesto, and also local artisan shortbread (a particular favorite of our ten year old!). Our son's other favorite snack/meal here is the grilled to order craft hot dogs and sausages. There are even vendors with upscale dog supplies, and also hand crafted Iphone/ipad wooden speakers. A fun way to spend some quality family time, and stimulate the local economy as well.

data.title: Nice Saturday Morning
data.text: My family and I visited the Farmers Market on July 4th weekend. I enjoyed it. Plenty of food choices and neat little stands. I will go back and get the Breakfast of Champions again!
